paragraph.materialsCitation: HONDURAS • 1 incomplete spec.; off Santa Rosa de Augán ; 16°07′ N , 85°38′ W ; R / V Pillsbury, Stn

subSubSection.paragraph: BODY. Pale maroon, long, very broad ( Fig. 15A ); 65 segments, 5.1 cm long, 1.4 cm to segment 30, 0.8 cm wide. Middorsal line covered with coarse sand and foraminifera attached to adhesive papillae ( Fig. 15E ). Venter covered with short globular and long dendritical papillae ( Fig. 15F ).

RIGHT PARAPODIUM FROM SEGMENT 26 (MIDDLE SEGMENT) ( Figs 15S , 16A ). Notopodia conical, smooth (nonpapillate), slightly shorter than neuropodia. With up to 120 simple verticillate notochaetae, shortest ones as long as notopodia, longest ones twice as long ( Figs 15T , 16B ). Neuropodia conical, papillate, longer than notopodia. Neurochaetae only falcigers; all blades unidentate, falcate: unit A, three falcigers with handles thick with subdistal transverse rows of denticles, blades short, 3–4× as long as wide ( Figs 15U , 16C ); unit B, two falcigers with handles thick with subdistal transverse rows of denticles, blades short,
CRUZ-GÓMEZ C., Pelogenins (Annelida) from the Grand Caribbean Region

subSubSection.paragraph: CRUZ-GÓMEZ C., Pelogenins (Annelida) from the Grand Caribbean Region
This specimen agrees with the original description by Pettibone (1997) .
Caribbean Sea. From Puerto Rico to Honduras .
